benchmark_details.name: OmniGIRL (A Multilingual and Multimodal Benchmark for GitHub Issue Resolution)
benchmark_details.overview: OmniGIRL is a GitHub issue resolution benchmark that is multilingual, multimodal, and multi-domain, including 959 task instances collected from repositories across four programming languages (Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, and Java) and eight different domains.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating issue resolution abilities of LLMs across multiple programming languages, domains, and input modalities.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited performance of current LLMs on multi-language issues and those requiring image understanding.

data.source: Collected from various GitHub repositories based on popularity and relevance across multiple domains.
data.annotation: Manually annotated with task instance information including issue descriptions, images, and website links.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the percentage of task instances that are resolved successfully and patches that can be applied without errors.
methodology.interpretation: Higher resolve and apply rates indicate better performance of the LLMs in issue resolution.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o with Agentless-X achieves the highest resolve rate of 8.6%.
methodology.validation: Execution-based filtering to ensure task instances have verifiable solutions.
